bill_title: direct the Department of Game, Fish and Parks to enter into negotiations with Indian tribes related to the management of Bear Butte State Park.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to direct the Department of Game, Fish and Parks to enter into negotiations with Indian tribes related to the management of Bear Butte State Park. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Department of Game, Fish and Parks shall enter into negotiations with the Indian tribes located in South Dakota to investigate avenues for greater tribal involvement in administration, management, and policy making functions with respect to Bear Butte State Park. The negotiations shall address cultural, religious, economic, recreational, environmental, and governmental considerations and shall focus on processes and procedures that will eventually allow the tribes to assume the management of Bear Butte State Park or to jointly manage the park with the state. The department shall report its progress and recommendations to the 2003 Legislature. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
